meanings.definition: Acting in a deceitful or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: The underhanding tactics of the sneaky fox were exposed by the clever rabbit.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her underhanding ways, always trying to trick others.
meanings.sent3: The underhanding squirrel tried to hide the nuts in the wrong tree, thinking no one would notice.
meanings.sent4: His underhanding behavior was like a shadow, always lurking in the background.
meanings.sent5: The underhanding smile on his face revealed his true intentions.

meanings.definition: To engage in sneaky or sly behavior.
meanings.sent1: He was underhanding his way through the crowd, trying to pickpocket unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent2: The cat was underhanding around the house, looking for a quiet spot to nap.
meanings.sent3: The underhanding raccoon snuck into the garbage can for a late-night snack.
meanings.sent4: She felt like underhanding her way out of the boring meeting, but decided to stay.
meanings.sent5: Underhanding through the maze of alleys, the thief made his escape.

meanings.definition: Done secretly or in a concealed manner.
meanings.sent1: The underhanding message was passed between the two spies without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent2: She received an underhanding gift in the mail, with no sender's name.
meanings.sent3: The underhanding cat snuck into the room and curled up on the bed without anyone seeing.
meanings.sent4: The underhanding wind carried the scent of flowers from the hidden garden.
meanings.sent5: The underhanding plan was executed under the cover of darkness.
